definition: to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role

sentences.english: A. I saw the boss hitting the ceiling just because he was late for 5 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，我看有次他迟到了5分钟，老板就气得跳脚了。

definition: stamp with fury/fly into a rage
flustered and exasperated/utterly discomfited
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
to abuse roundly
to get angry/to fume
to get really angry
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
red in the face/extremely angry
to shout/to bellow one's grievances
shouting and screaming (idiom); to scream loudly/to rant/to kick up a racket/to conduct vigorous propaganda
to curse (at sb)/to call sb names
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
to verbally abuse
to get angry/to burn with rage
gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth
